Dated on 22-11-2024
West Godavari District, Yelamanchili Mandal, Yelamanchili Village, Kotha Colony, Door.No. 1-60
Residents Kadali Muneswara Rao (Age 42 Years, Aadhaar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX) 5,
West Godavari District, Yelamanchili Mandal, Yelamanchili Village, Kotha Colony, Door. No. 1-60
Kapurastulu Kadali Muneswara Rao's wife Kadali Devi (age 39 years, Aadhaar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX) is a settlement deed for the immovable property given in writing.
You are my husband. Therefore, out of my love and affection for you, and in return for that love, I have the intention of giving you some immovable property free of charge for your future happiness, and with the intention of giving you the immovable property as per the schedule below, which is my property and which I have been fully entitled to till date, free of charge, I hereby give you the following Kadali Devi F SHI HOF 0014706512 Statutory Alert: 1 The authenticity of this Stamp certificate should be verified at www.shcilestamp.com or using e-Stamp Mobile App of Stock Holding Any discrepancy in the details on this Certificate and as available on the website/Mobile App renders it invalid 2. The onus of checking the legitimacy is on the users of the certificate. 3 In case of any discrepancy please inform the Competent Authority.
$100/100/100:100

The immovable property worth Rs. 6,58,000/- as per the schedule is hereby transferred to you free of charge and the said property is hereby taken into possession with full rights on this very day. Therefore, it is hereby decided that you shall be the full rightful owner of the said property and you shall enjoy it freely and comfortably, with all the rights of inheritance, sale, and sale rights, as you wish, for your sons and grandsons. It is hereby decided that I or my successors shall remove all encumbrances, encumbrances, and other encumbrances, whether they arise from anyone or not, at our own expense, and shall continue to execute this settlement deed for you or your successors without interruption. The immovable property in my name as per the Schedule is the property of my ancestors and I have been enjoying full possession of it till today. I hereby declare that the said property is an undisputed and unencumbered property, free from any mortgages, guarantees, seizures or other encumbrances, and that the number, boundaries, permit and door number are correct, and that this settlement document is written in your name.
This property is not an assigned property by the Government as per the provisions of A.P.G.O. No. 9/77.
Declaration: It is hereby declared that there are no items liable to additional stamp duty in the property transferred by this deed and it is hereby decided that if such factual details are found to have been concealed in this deed, a penalty of three times the amount as per G.O.M.S. No. 527/2002 shall be payable. Kadali Devi

Section 22-B Registration Act - 1908
Declaration :
: This declaration is to inform that in the course of preparing this document, I/We have taken all the necessary documents including the details of the property in the document, copies of the land title 1B, annexures, link document, land/house tax receipt, details of the parties in the link document, addresses of the parties, photographs of the parties, details of the property etc. and have examined all the aspects thoroughly and This deed has been prepared and recorded.
No matter that should have been written or recorded has been omitted from this deed.
The schedule property has been physically examined and measured and the deed has been prepared.
It is hereby confirmed that the said property has not been sold, mortgaged, etc. to any person, except for the possession of the said property, and that the said property is undisputed and that there are no dues payable on the said property.
It is agreed to pay the stamp duty if the said property is found in the future during the inspection of the said property by the authorities (Registration and Stamps and Revenue Department).
The provisions of Section 22-B of the Registration Act, 1908 We have not violated. And we are fully responsible for all other matters.
These have nothing to do with the Sub-Registrar or the Registrar of Deeds. This property is not the property of the Government, Endowment, Waqf Board and Assigned. If it is later found and investigated, we will be fully responsible for such decisions. We have read this document completely and this is a declaration that we have given our full consent.
Written by:
Kadali Loneshwar Rao Written by:

reportJson.propertyExtent: The total extent of the property is 145.2 Sq. Yds. after partial sale of an extent of 72.6 Sq. Yds. the remaining extent of the property is 72.6 Sq. Yds.

boundaries.boundaryN: Site Of Yandra Anjaneyulu, Gubbala Venkateswara Rao.

sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 13941 of 2024, dated 22/Nov/2024, executed by Kadali Devi, in favour of her Husband, Kadali Muneswrarao, towards the property admeasuring an extent of the total property is 145.2 Sq. Yds. after partial sale of an extent of 72.6 Sq. Yds. the remaining extent of the property is 72.6 Sq. Yds. bearing house number 6-80, Assessment No. 582, comprised in survey number  295/4, situated in Yelamanchili Village, Yelamanchili Mandal, within the District of West Godavari, registered at sub-registrar office Palakol, is bounded as follows:

North by: Land of Yandra Anjaneyulu, Gubbala Venkateswara Rao.
South by: Road.
East by: Road.
West by: Road.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is observed from the E.C. that Kadali Muneswrarao has executed a Partial Sale Deed vide Document No. 283 of 2026 for an extent of 72.6 Square Yards out of the total extent of 145.2 Sq. Yds. Hence, it is advised that the F.I. verify the remaining extent and obtain confirmation of the updated boundaries standing in the name of Kadali Muneswrarao. Fruther, It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
